result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph W Ewer

defendant.name: Ewer, Joseph W
defendant.address: W8335 E Parkview Rd, Ladysmith, WI 54848

records.addlTxt: Concurrent with case# 22CF179. DE must provide an updated address. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No contact with CE, HE or their residence.

9:36 AM Defendant Joseph W Ewer appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Joseph W Ewer.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF174 and 22CF179 heard at the same time.  Matters set for Bail/Bond hearings and PH.   Court informed DE of his right to appear at the hearing in person.  DE understands his rights and waived his personal appearance.    DE waived PH in 22CF174 and 22CF179.   Court informed DE of his rights as to PH.  DE understands and waived his PH.  Court reviewed CC and found PC to bind over DE on the charges contained in these cases.   Attorney Osberg argued for bond modifications.    Attorney Nelson argued to bond modifications.  Court AMENDED BOND AND ORDERED $250.00 cash bond, cases concurrent 22CF174 and 22CF179.    All other nonmonetary conditions in those bonds would remain in effect.  Court reminded DE he has no contacts on the bonds with CE and HE, and their residences.   Court also read existing conditions on the bonds that remain in effect.     ARGN set on both cases for 11/8/22 at 11:30 AM.   Adj. 9:47 AM
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:33 PM Defendant Joseph W Ewer appeared by video from the Rusk County Jail.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Joseph W Ewer.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Both cases 22CF174 ($500 cash bond in this case) and 22CF179 heard together.  Both set for INIT.     Bond addressed at a later date to allow victim notification.    PH set in both cases for 10/11/22 at 9:30 AM.   Bond will be addressed on 10/11/22 also.   Adj. 1:45 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

The original document was titled: Complaint Key - Ewer, Joseph W.pdf
The original history event date is: 09-27-2022

1:18 pm  DE appears in custody from RC Jail.  Atty Osberg appears for DE. State appears by ADA Nelson.  State enters bond argument, asks the court for a $2000.00 cash bond, absolute sobriety, no contact with CE, HE their residence, no operation of a m/v without a valid DL, and daily check ins with the SD if released.  Atty Osberg asks the court for a lesser amount.  Victim rights have been complied with.
